Name: Susano’s Greatsword
Effect: Pick any space. For 3 rounds, players will skip over that space and cannot land on it.

Name: Phoenix Down
Effect: Resurrects you at 1 point if you reach 0 points. This happens automatically.

Name: Max Potion
Effect: Drink this to gain 10 points.

Name: Benediction
Effect: Your points become the same as the player with the highest score.

Name: Shadowflare
Effect: Pick any space within 10 spaces of your position. For 1 turn, anyone who passes through that space takes 3 damage.

Name: Energy Drain
Effect: Pick any player and steal 3 points from them.

Name: Echo
Effect: You may reroll your movement roll before you advance and pick either result.

Name: Pixie Plums
Effect: Gain 3 points.

Name: Cordial
Effect: Drink this to move 2 extra spaces.

Name: Summon
Effect: Roll on the summon table and take no damage from the effect.

Name: Potion of Harmony
Effect: Drink this to ignore the effects of the aether table for one turn.

Name: Afflatus Misery
Effect: Deal 25 damage to a player of your choice. Skip your next turn.

Name: Tactician
Effect: Used automatically the next time you take damage. Reduce the damage taken by 3.

Name: Meditation
Effect: Skip a turn. You gain 10 points and roll twice for movement on your next turn.

Name: Delirium
Effect: Used automatically when you win a duel. You gain 5 extra points.

Name: High Jump
Effect: Move 5 spaces in any direction.

Name: Brand of Purgatory
Effect: Everyone else takes 3 damage.

Name: Automaton Queen
Effect: A robot that automatically fights one duel for you. You take no damage and gain no points from your next duel. You still roll for the duel and your opponent can still take damage.

Name: Goka Mekkyaku
Effect: Choose any space. Deal 5 damage to players within 2 spaces of the space chosen.

Name: Hissatsu: Senei
Effect: Deal 25 damage to a player of your choice. Skip your next turn.

Name: Recitation
Effect: Used automatically the next time you gain points. You gain triple the points.

Name: Wildfire
Effect: Pick a player. For 2 rounds, that player takes double damage.

Name: Hallowed Ground
Effect: You are immune to damage for 3 rounds.

Name: Zantetsuken
Effect: Used automatically after acquiring it and lasts for 7 rounds after the original owner acquires it. The holder of this treasure cannot gain or lose points in any way. The holder must roll twice for movement and must duel anyone that they pass or who passes them. The winner of the duel becomes the new holder (and loses all of their treasure.) While this treasure is equipped, it cannot be overwritten or removed unless it’s by losing a duel.

Name: Allagan Portal
Effect: Pick any player (including yourself) and teleport them to any space without activating that space’s effect.

Name: Fountain of Fire
Effect: Deal 4 damage to any player.

Name: Temperance
Effect: For 1 round, any damage you take is reduced by 2 and you gain 2 extra points whenever you gain points.

Name: Plunge
Effect: Advance to the person ahead of you and duel them.

Name: Trick Attack
Effect: Can only be used when you begin your turn exactly behind another player. For 5 rounds, that player takes 3 extra damage whenever they take damage.

Name: Camouflage
Effect: You take no damage from damaging spaces for 3 rounds.

Name: Tupsimati
Effect: You can activate this treasure when a summon or diversion space effect is first activated. Negate the effect and halve the points of the person who activated that effect.

Name: Belias-Egi
Effect: Pick any player. That person takes 5 damage.

Name: Collective Unconscious
Effect: For 3 rounds, you gain 2 points at the beginning of your turns and any damage you take is reduced by 2.

Name: Ageless Words
Effect: During this turn, you roll two dice for movement instead of one.

Name: Aqua Breath
Effect: Can only be used when there are 2 or more players within 5 spaces of you. All other players within 5 spaces of you take 3 damage and must roll /dice. Any players who roll below 5 takes 9 damage.

Name: Assassinate
Effect: This treasure can only be used when you win a duel against another player. Roll again for damage and deal 3x that roll to that player.

Name: Art of War
Effect: Deal 5 damage to all players within 5 spaces of you.

Name: Astral Stasis
Effect: The score you have when you first receive this treasure is saved. The next time you fall unconscious, you recover immediately and your score is restored to that amount

Name: Aurora
Effect: You gain 7 points.

Name: Atonement
Effect: Used automatically during your next duel. Gain points equal to what you roll for damage.

Name: Bioblaster
Effect: All other players take 6 damage.

Name: Bladeshower
Effect: This treasure can only be used when there are 1 or more players within 5 spaces of you. Roll for damage and deal that damage multiplied by the number of players within 5 spaces of you to each of them.

Name: Blizzard IV
Effect: Pick any player. Roll for damage and deal it to that player. You are then immune to damage spaces for 2 rounds.

Name: Blood Drain
Effect: Target the player with the lowest score. Deal 3 damage to that player and then you gain 3 points.

Name: Blood of the Dragon
Effect: This treasure activates automatically during your next duel. Add 5 to your damage roll. If you win the duel, advance to the space behind the next player.

Name: Blood Weapon
Effect: This treasure is activated when you receive it and lasts until you lose a duel. You gain 3 more points every time you win a duel.

Name: Bloodbath
Effect: For 5 rounds, gain 1 point every time a player lands on a damaging space.

Name: Bloodletter
Effect: You can only activate this treasure at the beginning of another player’s turn. That player doesn’t roll for movement and instead advances to the closest damage space and takes double the damage.

Name: Bloodshower
Effect: Deal 6 damage to all players who are currently standing on a damage space.

Name: Bomb Toss
Effect: Pick any space on the board and start a counter that increases at the end of each round. The next player that passes through that space takes damage equal to the counter.

Name: Brotherhood
Effect: You can activate this treasure when a duel that doesn’t involve you takes place. Save the damage roll difference of that duel. During your next duel, that difference is added to your damage roll.

Name: Bunshin
Effect: This treasure is activated automatically during your next duel. Your attack roll is doubled.

Name: Byregot’s Miracle
Effect: When you get this treasure, roll on the treasure table and keep that treasure instead of this one. When you lose/use that treasure, you gain it again immediately.

Name: Calm Waters
Effect: For 3 rounds, you are immune to damage spaces.

Name: Celestial Intersection
Effect: Roll for damage. You gain that many points. For the next 3 rounds, any damage you take is reduced by that amount.

Name: Confiteor
Effect: This treasure activates automatically the next time you win a duel. Deal the damage difference to all players other than yourself.

Name: Dark Force
Effect: You gain a protective shield of 30 points that lasts 5 rounds.

Name: Death Blossom
Effect: All players within 5 spaces of you take 5 damage.

Name: Diamondback
Effect: You can activate this treasure when your points are about to be reduced. Pick a number of turns from 1-5. You lose that many turns, but your points aren't affected in any way for the duration.

Name: Dissipation
Effect: You can use this treasure when you roll on the summoning deck. Negate the effects of the summon and gain 5 points.

Name: Dream Within a Dream
Effect: You can activate this treasure when a player loses a turn by rolling a 0 for movement or by an effect. That player loses another turn and takes 5 damage.

Name: Doom
Effect: Pick any player. That player will become unconscious and their score reduced to 0 in a number of rounds equal to the lowest score.

Name: Drill
Effect: Pick any player. That player takes 8 damage and is knocked back one space.

Name: Dragon Kick
Effect: This treasure activates automatically when you land on the same space as another player during your turn. You do not trigger a duel, but instead deal 5 damage to the other player and then push them forward one space.

Name: Dragonsong Dive
Effect: Pick a player within 3 spaces of you and deal 30 damage to them.

Name: Enkindle
Effect: You can use this treasure when someone draws on the summon deck. Pick any player including yourself. That player’s points are affected twice by the effect of the summon.

Name: Esuna
Effect: Pick any player including yourself and remove all effects affecting that player.

Name: Flare
Effect: Pick any space on the board. Players within 5 spaces of that space take damage equal to your score. Your score is then reduced to 1.

Name: Flying Sardine
Effect: Pick any player. That player takes 1 damage and is knocked forward 1 space.

Name: Flood of Darkness
Effect: All players within 10 spaces ahead of you take 5 damage.

Name: Flying Frenzy
Effect: Pick any player and jump to the same space as them. Anyone within 3 spaces of you takes 3 damage.

Name: Forbidden Chakra
Effect: Pick any player and then choose a number of turns. You spend that number of turns meditating and can’t take any actions or movement. At the end of the last meditating turn, deal damage to that player equal to the number of turns spent meditating multiplied by 5. If another player duels you while you’re meditating and you lose, you are interrupted and the effect of this treasure is completely canceled.

Name: Gravity
Effect: Pick any space on the board. Players within 10 spaces of it take 3 damage and advance 3 spaces towards it without activating effects.

Name: Holmgang
Effect: This treasure activates automatically when you’re about to be knocked unconscious. Your score becomes 1 instead of 0.

Name: Hook
Effect: Pick any player ahead of you and pull him to your space.

Name: Identical Cast
Effect: You can use this treasure when another player rolls on the treasure table. You gain the same treasure as that player.

Name: Ink Jet
Effect: Pick any player and deal 3 damage to them. During their next movement roll, that player moves backwards instead of forward.

Name: Impact
Effect: Deal 5 damage to any player and all players within 5 spaces of them.

Name: Lalafell Sacrifice
Effect: Pick a player within 3 spaces of you. Deal damage to that player equal to your score difference.

Name: Interject
Effect: You can use this treasure when another player is about to use their own treasure. The action is cancelled and the player loses that treasure.

Name: Iron Jaws
Effect: This treasure can only be activated when another player takes damage. That player takes an additional 7 damage.

Name: Jinpu
Effect: This treasure activates automatically during your next duel. You deal double damage.

Name: Level 5 Petrify
Effect: All players excluding you roll /dice. Any player who rolls below 3 loses 5 turns.

Name: Living Dead
Effect: You can activate this treasure when you’re about to take damage that would knock you unconscious. Your score is reduced to 1 instead. If in 5 rounds your score is not 15 or above, it is reduced to 0 and you are knocked unconscious.

Name: Lightspeed
Effect: For 2 rounds, your movement is doubled.

Name: Living Shadow
Effect: Until the end of your next turn, all damage you deal is doubled.

Name: Boiled Egg
Effect: Eat to gain 5 points OR Throw at a nearby opponent. If thrown, the target must /dice. If 5 or higher is rolled, the target may catch the egg with their mouth and gain 5 points. If not, the egg smashes into their face and they lose 5 points.
